title: Family Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Family & Children's Services (Tulsa, OK)
Interview Descriptions: I got a call about two weeks after submitting my interview. Everyone was friendly and made you feel comfortable during the interviews. There was a total of two in person interviews and the  questions were mostly behavioral.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you disagreed with your boss?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Family & Children's Services (Tulsa, OK) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial interview with case coordinator.  Depending on the initial interview one is invited to a follow-up interview with the director. The interview was casual and more like a conversation.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you were in conflict with a supervisor

title: Family Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Family & Children's Services (Tulsa, OK) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very comfortable and easygoing. I was interviewed by one person and it was more of a conversation rather than an "interrogation." I was asked questions about my experience working with children and families and how I would respond to certain situations.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience working with children and families.

title: Coor, Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Family & Children's Services (Baltimore, MD) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was geat and you could still the people were happy to be workng for the company. My  contact person greeted me with a smile. The process was set-up in a room that was private, clean, well lite as well as interesting because it had a wealrh of book throughout room.

title: Front Desk Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Family & Children's Services (Tulsa, OK) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: They go through multiple open ended questions to ask you what experiences you have in certain situations. There is two interviews required from different supervisors. There is no way to go around this process, but there is a good chance that if you're a decent person, you will get the job.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time where you were in a power struggle with a co-worker? How did you handle it, and what where the results?

title: Clinical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Family & Children's Services
Interview Descriptions: I was fresh out of grad school, no clinical experience, applied to several agencies, and got only one opportunity for an interview after two months with this agency.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question for me was: What would you do if one of our doctors who also see the client you work with does not agree with your diagnosis?
